fields.localized_string: Your contribution will go to sustaining development as we add great features to the next versions of Gmail S/MIME and other software! For example, we have been looking into signature verification and support for additional HTML features.

I got involved with Gmail S/MIME because it offers users a way to get real end-to-end privacy and confidence in their e-mail messages. Using this add-on, users can communicate with a recognized, standardized protocol that is built into every major software-based e-mail client. The last great frontier is webmail, and that is where we can make a big difference! I have heard from many people and organizations around the world about how our software enables them to communicate in commercially sensitive, politically sensitive, or actively hostile environments, frequently preventing embarrassing situations, and sometimes even saving lives. Our software empowers people to communicate at their fullest potential.

Gmail S/MIME (the Program) is separately and respectively written by
Richard Jones and Sean Leonard. Said respective portions are:
	   Copyright (C) 2005-2007 Richard Jones.
	   Copyright (C) 2007 Sean Leonard of SeanTek(R).
	 SeanTek is a registered trademark of Sean Leonard.

Please update Gmail S/MIME to 0.4.7 for the latest updates and fixes.

Help on using this extension can be found at:
http://richard.jones.name/google-hacks/gmail-smime/gmail-smime.html
http://www.seantek.com/gmailsmime/

Please contact the developers directly if you have questions or problems. We do not monitor the comments on this website regularly.

If you want others to send you encrypted mail, you need a digital certificate. You can get a free one from Comodo at:
http://www.instantssl.com/ssl-certificate-products/free-email-certificate.html
Just follow the prompts to have the certificate installed directly in your browser. Sending your certificate to others is as easy as clicking “Sign” on the toolbar. For more information, visit:
http://kb.mozillazine.org/Getting_an_SMIME_certificate

Always remember to look at the toolbar before sending a message, to see whether you are signing or encrypting it. By default, messages are not signed, but are automatically encrypted if you have digital certificates for all of the recipients.

Send us e-mail if you have additional questions or comments. Feel free to send us signed and encrypted e-mail, too. We can read them now. :-)

Sending your certificate to others is as easy as clicking “Sign” on the toolbar. For more information, visit: http://kb.mozillazine.org/Getting_an_SMIME_certificate Always remember to look at the toolbar before sending a message, to see whether you are signing or encrypting it. By default, messages are not signed, but are automatically encrypted if you have digital certificates for all of the recipients. Send us e-mail if you have additional questions or comments. Feel free to send us signed and encrypted e-mail, too. We can read them now. :-)

fields.localized_string: Send and receive signed and encrypted messages in Gmail.
fields.localized_string_clean: Send and receive signed and encrypted messages in Gmail.

fields.localized_string:
We encourage all users to update to 0.4.7, which addresses recent changes in the Gmail interface and adds more robust processing for certain types of S/MIME messages (namely encrypted and “opaque-signed” messages).

With the Gmail S/MIME extension, you can send and receive signed and encrypted S/MIME messages in Gmail. Secure your e-mail today, including your attachments! Version 0.4.5 inter-operates with every S/MIME-capable mail client including Microsoft Outlook (2000-2007), Microsoft Outlook Express, Mozilla Thunderbird, and Apple Mail.app, and now works up through Firefox 3.7a1pre, Seamonkey, and the latest versions of Gmail.
fields.localized_string_clean:
We encourage all users to update to 0.4.7, which addresses recent changes in the Gmail interface and adds more robust processing for certain types of S/MIME messages (namely encrypted and “opaque-signed” messages).

With the Gmail S/MIME extension, you can send and receive signed and encrypted S/MIME messages in Gmail. Secure your e-mail today, including your attachments! Version 0.4.5 inter-operates with every S/MIME-capable mail client including Microsoft Outlook (2000-2007), Microsoft Outlook Express, Mozilla Thunderbird, and Apple Mail.app, and now works up through Firefox 3.7a1pre, Seamonkey, and the latest versions of Gmail.

fields.localized_string: Version 0.4.7 fixes the progress message display, and updates Gmail function signatures. We encourage everyone to update to this version of Gmail S/MIME.
fields.localized_string_clean: Version 0.4.7 fixes the progress message display, and updates Gmail function signatures. We encourage everyone to update to this version of Gmail S/MIME.
